013    package net.sf.oval.constraint;
014    
015    import java.lang.annotation.Documented;
016    import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
017    import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
018    import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
019    import java.lang.annotation.Target;
020    
021    import net.sf.oval.ConstraintViolation;
022    import net.sf.oval.configuration.annotation.Constraint;
023    
024    /**
025     * Check if the date is within the a date range.
026     * 
027     * <br><br>
028     * <b>Note:</b> This constraint is also satisfied when the value to validate is null, therefore you might also need to specified @NotNull
029     * 
030     * @author Sebastian Thomschke
031     */
032    @Documented
033    @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
034    @Target({ElementType.FIELD, ElementType.PARAMETER, ElementType.METHOD})
035    @Constraint(checkWith = DateRangeCheck.class)
036    public @interface DateRange
037    {
038            /**
039             * error code passed to the ConstraintViolation object
040             */
041            String errorCode() default "net.sf.oval.constraint.DateRange";
042    
043            /**
044             * The format of the specified dates in a form understandable by the SimpleDateFormat class.
045             * Defaults to the default format style of the default locale.
046             */
047            String format() default "";
048    
049            /**
050             * The upper date compared against in the format specified with the dateFormat parameter. 
051             * If not specified then no upper boundary check is performed.<br>
052             * Special values are:
053             * <ul>
054             * <li><code>now</code>
055             * <li><code>today</code>
056             * <li><code>yesterday</code>
057             * <li><code>tomorrow</code>
058             * </ul>
059             */
060            String max() default "";
061    
062            /**
063             * message to be used for the ContraintsViolatedException
064             * 
065             * @see ConstraintViolation
066             */
067            String message() default "net.sf.oval.constraint.DateRange.violated";
068    
069            /**
070             * The lower date compared against in the format specified with the dateFormat parameter. 
071             * If not specified then no upper boundary check is performed.<br>
072             * Special values are:
073             * <ul>
074             * <li><code>now</code>
075             * <li><code>today</code>
076             * <li><code>yesterday</code>
077             * <li><code>tomorrow</code>
078             * </ul>
079             */
080            String min() default "";
081    
082            /**
083             * The associated constraint profiles.
084             */
085            String[] profiles() default {};
086    
087            /**
088             * severity passed to the ConstraintViolation object
089             */
090            int severity() default 0;
091    }
